For 47 seasons, Patriots
fan has been on the scene

Charles Underhill has been a season ticket holder since 1966. He says he's missed one regular-season home game.
Opinion | LAWRENCE HARMON

Cultural institutions need to pay up

Boston’s leading arts and cultural institutions elevate spirits, but they lack appreciation for the high cost of providing police, fire, and road services.

Maine baseball card may be oldest

An old photo album found at a Maine yard sale yielded what is believed to be the first baseball card ever printed, and it is expected to fetch six figures at auction.
Opinion | Neal Gabler

Hard facts vs. big truths

Just about everyone accepts that artists can exercise certain liberties when they deal with history. But do they have an obligation to be truthful?

Loss of Salem church brings pain

Workers began razing St. Joseph Church on Lafayette Street in the Point neighborhood of Salem this week after years of legal wrangling.

Brown faces battle over party chair

Scott Brown has been embroiled in a fight for office -- over the chairmanship of the Massachusetts Republican Party.
Appreciation

Ada Louise Huxtable's New England

Huxtable, who died Monday, was the most influential writer on architecture of her time. Though a New Yorker at heart, she had an unpretentious one-story house in Marblehead.
